intro: Lochemia, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Lochemia has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
